title: test_AnnexRepo_addurl_to_file_batched broken
body:
Revealed by #5080 

```
======================================================================
1766ERROR: datalad.support.tests.test_annexrepo.test_AnnexRepo_addurl_to_file_batched
1767----------------------------------------------------------------------
1768Traceback (most recent call last):
1769  File "C:\Miniconda35\envs\test-environment\lib\site-packages\nose\case.py", line 198, in runTest
1770    self.test(*self.arg)
1771  File "C:\Miniconda35\envs\test-environment\lib\site-packages\datalad\tests\utils.py", line 573, in _wrap_with_tree
1772    return t(*(arg + (d,)), **kw)
1773  File "C:\Miniconda35\envs\test-environment\lib\site-packages\datalad\tests\utils.py", line 685, in _wrap_serve_path_via_http
1774    return tfunc(*(args + (path, url)), **kwargs)
1775  File "C:\Miniconda35\envs\test-environment\lib\site-packages\datalad\tests\utils.py", line 750, in _wrap_with_tempfile
1776    return t(*(arg + (filename,)), **kw)
1777  File "C:\Miniconda35\envs\test-environment\lib\site-packages\datalad\support\tests\test_annexrepo.py", line 1015, in test_AnnexRepo_addurl_to_file_batched
1778    eq_(info['size'], 14)
1779TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not subscriptable
1780
```

Replicates in both `maint` and `master` on a real win10 box.

Looking at the following, it seems that `addurl_to_file()` is working, but `AnnexRepo.info()` is broken.

```
(Pdb) l
1010        # Remove it and re-add
1011        unlink(opj(dst, testfile))
1012        ar.add_url_to_file(testfile, testurl, batch=True)
1013
1014        info = ar.info(testfile)
1015 ->     eq_(info['size'], 14)
1016        assert(info['key'])
1017        # not even added to index yet since we this repo is with default batch_size
1018        assert_not_in(WEB_SPECIAL_REMOTE_UUID, ar.whereis(testfile))
1019
1020        # TODO: none of the below should re-initiate the batch process
(Pdb) p info
None
(Pdb) p testfile
'about.txt'
(Pdb) p testurl
'http://127.0.0.1:65330/about.txt'
(Pdb) open(ar.pathobj / testfile).read()
'Lots of abouts'
```

Not so fast:

```
\code\datalad\datalad\support\annexrepo.py(2507)info()
-> j = None
(Pdb) p j
{'command': 'info', 'note': 'not a directory or an annexed file or a treeish or a remote or a uuid', 'success': False, 'error-messages': []}
(Pdb) p json_objects
[{'command': 'info', 'note': 'not a directory or an annexed file or a treeish or a remote or a uuid', 'success': False, 'error-messages': []}]
(Pdb) p files
['about.txt']
```

Indeed the file is reported as untracked. So `info()` is fine. Back to `add_url_to_file()`, which report:

```
{'command': 'addurl', 'note': 'to about.txt', 'success': True, 'key': 'SHA256E-s14--198775960d0d9827f134da4e219e5793949d24b62bfcb92aa9e2dc16d411b776.txt', 'error-messages': [], 'file': 'about.txt'}
```

but leaves the file untracked. However, running `git annex addurl http://127.0.0.1:65379/about.txt --file some` produces a staged file `some`. And batch mode is not to blame either:

```cmd
% git annex addurl --batch --with-files
http://127.0.0.1:65379/about.txt some
addurl http://127.0.0.1:65379/about.txt
(to some) ok
^Z
(recording state in git...)

(base) C:\Users\mih\AppData\Local\Temp\datalad_temp_sc6zjqlq>git status
On branch adjusted/dl-test-branch(unlocked)
Changes to be committed:
  (use "git restore --staged <file>..." to unstage)
        new file:   some
```

Which points the finger to the implementation of a batched annex in datalad.

(detaching here)
